attributes.action: Address House Prices and Making Life Affordable for the Working Class
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition is to get the government to recognise that we have a problem with house prices. To understand that we, the people cannot afford the simple and most basic cost of putting a roof over our heads.

Property prices are uncontrollably increasing but our salaries are being squeezed by international pressure from cheaper salaries abroad. As a result our salaries will never keep up with the property market. 

Also house prices/capital repayments are not included in the Retail Price Index (RPI) so inflation does not reflect the true cost of living (house prices have doubled in 3 years and capital mortgage repayments have doubled as well). So Inflation looks like a few percent a year but in reality our true cost of living has increased considerably more than just a few percent due to house prices.

In short prime minister, please help reduce house prices and make life affordable for your people.
